definitions.definition: to bring into such close relationship as to obscure individual characters : merge
examples: two companies combining forces

definitions.definition: to cause to unite into a chemical compound
examples: combining hydrofluoric acid with soda ash to form sodium fluoride

definitions.definition: to unite into a single number or expression
examples: Combine fractions and simplify.

definitions.definition: intermix, blend
examples: Combine the sugar and flour.

definitions.definition: to possess in combination
examples: a writer whose works combine imagination and scholarship

definitions.definition: to become one
examples: The two newspapers combined as the Chronicle.

definitions.definition: to unite to form a chemical compound
to act together
examples: Many factors combined to cause the recession.
Wolves combine in their hunt for deer.

definitions.definition: a combination especially of business or political interests
examples: … Grumman Corp. lost the advanced tactical aircraft contract to the combine of McDonnell Douglas and General Dynamics.
—George J. Church

definitions.definition: an event at which scouts from the teams in a professional sports league gather to evaluate players in preparation for choosing which players to draft
examples: a scouting combine

Every spring the National Football League conducts that most cherished of American rituals, the college draft. A couple of months before the event, prospective players show off their abilities in an athletic audition known as the combine.
—Carl Zimmer

definitions.definition: a harvesting machine that heads, threshes, and cleans grain while moving over a field
to harvest with a combine
to combine a crop
to bring into close relationship : unify
to mix together so that the identity of each part is lost
examples: combine the ingredients of a recipe

definitions.definition: to become one
to unite to form a chemical compound
a union of persons or groups especially for business or political benefits
a machine that harvests, threshes, and cleans grain while moving over a field
to cause to unite into a chemical compound
to unite to form a chemical compound
to (cause to) exist together, or join together to make a single thing or group:
examples: None of us has much money so let's combine what we've got.
Sickness, combined with (= together with) terrible weather, contrived to ruin the trip.
The two countries combined against their common enemy.

definitions.definition: If someone combines two or more qualities, they have both of those qualities:
examples: As a writer, he combined wit and passion.
The band combines musical talent with brilliant showmanship.

definitions.definition: to do two activities at the same time:
examples: She manages to successfully combine family life and a career.
This exercise combines stretching with deep breathing.

definitions.definition: a group of people or organizations acting together in business:
examples: a Japanese industrial combine

definitions.definition: a large farming machine that cuts the plant, separates the seed from the stem, and cleans the grain as it moves across a field
to (cause to) exist together, or join together to make a single thing or group
examples: None of us has much money so let's combine what we've got.
Sickness, combined with (= together with) terrible weather, contrived to ruin the trip.
The two countries combined against their common enemy.
definitions.translation: （使）结合；（使）联合；（使）合并；（使）综合

definitions.definition: If someone combines two or more qualities, they have both of those qualities.
examples: As a writer, he combined wit and/with passion.

definitions.definition: to do two activities at the same time
examples: She manages to successfully combine family life and/with a career.
definitions.translation: 兼办，兼做，同时做（两种活动）

definitions.definition: a group of people or organizations acting together in business
examples: a Japanese industrial combine

definitions.definition: a large farming machine that cuts the plant, separates the seed from the stem, and cleans the grain as it moves across a field
if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together
examples: Augustine was later to combine elements of this philosophy with the teachings of Christianity.
Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
A number of factors have combined to create this difficult situation.
Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
The combined effects of the war and the drought resulted in famine.
Augustine was later to combine elements of this philosophy with the teachings of Christianity.
Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
A number of factors have combined to create this difficult situation.

collocations.meaning: the result of two or more different things used or mixed together
examples: The combined effects of the war and the drought resulted in famine.

definitions.definition: to have two or more different features or qualities at the same time
examples: Good carpet wool needs to combine softness with strength.
Good carpet wool needs to combine softness with strength.

definitions.definition: if two or more different substances combine, or if you combine them, they mix or join together to produce a new single substance
examples: Different amino acids combine to form proteins.
Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.
Steel is produced by combining iron with carbon.
Different amino acids combine to form proteins.
Steel is produced by combining iron with carbon.

definitions.definition: to do two different activities at the same time
examples: Many people enjoy combining a holiday with learning a new skill.
the problems facing women who wish to combine a career and family
Many people enjoy combining a holiday with learning a new skill.
the problems facing women who wish to combine a career and family

collocations.meaning: work and enjoy yourself at the same time

definitions.definition: if two or more groups, organizations etc combine, or if you combine them, they join or work together in order to do something
examples: Ten British and French companies combined to form the Channel Tunnel Group.
University zoologists and government vets are combining forces (=working together) to investigate the disease.
Ten British and French companies combined to form the Channel Tunnel Group.

definitions.definition: a machine used by farmers to cut grain, separate the seeds from it, and clean it
a group of people, businesses etc who work together
examples: The factory was sold to a British combine after the war.

definitions.definition: if two or more groups or organizations combine, or if you combine them, they join together
examples: They said they expect no job losses from combining their operations.
Two old established practices combined to form The Anthony Clark Partnership.
Two old established practices combined to form The Anthony Clark Partnership.

definitions.definition: an association of two or more businesses or companies that work together on a temporary or permanent basis
examples: a large regional banking combine
There may be concern if one airline combine controls more than 25% of a relevant market.

examples: Little was to be expected from [combining forces] and votes in international organisations.
